titleStmt.title: Letter from &C;u-Suen to &C;arrum-bāni about digging a trench -- an English prose translation

publicationStmt.distributor: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature

address.addrLine: The Oriental Institute, University of Oxford, Pusey Lane, Oxford OX1 2LE, UK, email etcsl@orinst.ox.ac.uk, http://etcsl.orinst.ox.ac.uk

seriesStmt.p: The Electronic Text Corpus of Sumerian Literature aims to make accessible over 400 literary works composed in the Sumerian language in ancient Mesopotamia during the late third and early second millennia BC. The works are in Sumerian composite transliteration and English prose translation with bibliographical information on each composition.

sourceDesc.p: Sources are listed in the header of the composite text

body.p: Say to &C;arrum-bāni: this is what &C;u-Suen, your lord, says:

The messenger whom you have sent to me &X;&X;. &X;&X; you do not exceed &X;&X; my instructions, as I ordered you.
As for myself, whatever you say to me &X;&X;.

When you went into the province -- who but you (?) has approached the province? Spending the night &X;&X;. When their dignitaries have &X;&X; their words, if &X;&X;
Their dignitaries should stand by you in (?) their quarters. When their &X;&X; have been cast away, they themselves &X;&X; the province.

If &X;&X; officials should pass by (?),
By (?) placing the enemy, their cities, their borders &X;&X;, until they come down
1 ms. has instead: they come out from their fortress , they must not overturn it!

When their men had killed, their women
1 ms. has instead: their soldiers passed (?) through your cities of the province; it was not &X;&X;.
That was how I instructed you. Why did you not act as I ordered you?
You were not empowered to kill anyone, to blind (?) people or to destroy cities; but I gave you authority to do so.
When my father &C;ulgi built the fortress &X;&X;, it was not you people who were involved -- and my throne is not the throne of &C;ulgi!
Concerning Lu-Enki, the ruler of the province of Zimudar, he should come to you, and should bring with him 60 troops. Let them be sent together with &X;&X;.
&X;&X;, the archivist, made &X;&X; limited (?). According to the instructions that have been given to him, he should build that fortress.
And as for you, with the soldiers who are under your authority, get the trench dug!
So as not to change the attitude of the province, you people are not to release the workers while the land has not yet been secured.
Let messengers bring me news about those eastern provinces. This is urgent!
